data: Well, well, it was not always so.—The father of the man who now rides to town with white reins for his horse, and who drinks his couple of bottles of champagne, had probably nothing better than small beer with which to quench his thirst, and had his reins tied together with his wife’s garter.
An Old Story of My Farming Days Vol. 1
browsing: culture/civilization/society|browsing: fiction|category: novels|category: german literature
